items.creator: Bill Toulas
items.title: Police seizes largest German online crime marketplace, arrests admin
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
items.content: Germany has taken down the largest online cybercrime marketplace in the country, named "Crimenetwork," and arrested its administrator for facilitating the sale of drugs, stolen data, and illegal services. [...]
items.contentSnippet: Germany has taken down the largest online cybercrime marketplace in the country, named "Crimenetwork," and arrested its administrator for facilitating the sale of drugs, stolen data, and illegal services. [...]

items.creator: Sergiu Gatlan
items.title: FTC bans data brokers from selling Americans’ sensitive location data
items.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
items.content: Today, the FTC banned data brokers Mobilewalla and Gravy Analytics from harvesting and selling Americans' location tracking data linked to sensitive locations, like churches, healthcare facilities, military installations, and schools. [...]
items.contentSnippet: Today, the FTC banned data brokers Mobilewalla and Gravy Analytics from harvesting and selling Americans' location tracking data linked to sensitive locations, like churches, healthcare facilities, military installations, and schools. [...]

items.creator: Bill Toulas
items.title: Police seize Matrix encrypted chat service after spying on criminals
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
items.content: An international law enforcement operation codenamed 'Operation Passionflower' has shut down MATRIX, an encrypted messaging platform used by cybercriminals to coordinate illegal activities while evading police. [...]
items.contentSnippet: An international law enforcement operation codenamed 'Operation Passionflower' has shut down MATRIX, an encrypted messaging platform used by cybercriminals to coordinate illegal activities while evading police. [...]

items.creator: Bill Toulas
items.title: Korea arrests CEO for adding DDoS feature to satellite receivers
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
items.content: South Korean police have arrested a CEO and five employees for manufacturing over 240,000 satellite receivers pre-loaded or later updated to include DDoS attack functionality at a purchaser's request. [...]
items.contentSnippet: South Korean police have arrested a CEO and five employees for manufacturing over 240,000 satellite receivers pre-loaded or later updated to include DDoS attack functionality at a purchaser's request. [...]

items.creator: Sergiu Gatlan
items.title: Russia sentences Hydra dark web market leader to life in prison
items.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
items.content: Russian authorities have sentenced the leader of the criminal group behind the now-closed dark web platform Hydra Market to life in prison. [...]
items.contentSnippet: Russian authorities have sentenced the leader of the criminal group behind the now-closed dark web platform Hydra Market to life in prison. [...]

items.creator: Bill Toulas
items.title: BootKitty UEFI malware exploits LogoFAIL to infect Linux systems
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
items.content: The recently uncovered 'Bootkitty' UEFI bootkit, the first malware of its kind targeting Linux systems, exploits CVE-2023-40238, aka 'LogoFAIL,' to infect computers running on a vulnerable UEFI firmware. [...]
items.contentSnippet: The recently uncovered 'Bootkitty' UEFI bootkit, the first malware of its kind targeting Linux systems, exploits CVE-2023-40238, aka 'LogoFAIL,' to infect computers running on a vulnerable UEFI firmware. [...]

items.creator: Mayank Parmar
items.title: Mozilla really wants you to set Firefox as default Windows browser
items.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
items.content: In an effort to turn the tide, Mozilla is testing a fresh approach that could persuade more people to switch their default browser on Windows during the installation of the browser. [...]
items.contentSnippet: In an effort to turn the tide, Mozilla is testing a fresh approach that could persuade more people to switch their default browser on Windows during the installation of the browser. [...]

items.creator: Mayank Parmar
items.title: Google Chrome’s AI feature lets you quickly check website trustworthiness
items.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
items.content: Google Chrome's upcoming feature uses AI to provide a summary of reviews from independent websites about the store or website you're visiting. [...]
items.contentSnippet: Google Chrome's upcoming feature uses AI to provide a summary of reviews from independent websites about the store or website you're visiting. [...]

items.creator: Lawrence Abrams
items.title: Novel phishing campaign uses corrupted Word documents to evade security
items.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
items.content: A novel phishing attack abuses Microsoft's Word file recovery feature by sending corrupted Word documents as email attachments, allowing them to bypass security software due to their damaged state but still be recoverable by the application. [...]
items.contentSnippet: A novel phishing attack abuses Microsoft's Word file recovery feature by sending corrupted Word documents as email attachments, allowing them to bypass security software due to their damaged state but still be recoverable by the application. [...]

items.creator: Bill Toulas
items.title: SpyLoan Android malware on Google Play installed 8 million times
items.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
items.content: A new set of 15 SpyLoan Android malware apps with over 8 million installs was discovered on Google Play, targeting primarily users from South America, Southeast Asia, and Africa. [...]
items.contentSnippet: A new set of 15 SpyLoan Android malware apps with over 8 million installs was discovered on Google Play, targeting primarily users from South America, Southeast Asia, and Africa. [...]
